Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING ARRANGEMENTS
Subsubsection Text: The Senior Facilities Agreement originally provided for (i) a senior term loan facility in a principal amount of up to £195,000,000 (“Original Facility A”), (ii) a euro denominated senior term loan facility in a principal amount of €845,000,000 (“Original Facility B”), (iii) a revolving credit facility in an original principal amount of £500,000,000 (the “Original Revolving Facility”) and (iv) a revolving credit facility in a principal amount of £190,000,000 (the “Original Revolving Facility 2”) which was voluntarily cancelled by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer in full on September 16, 2021. In connection with the EG UK Acquisition, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer entered into (i) an additional term facility notice under the Senior Facilities Agreement with, among others, Apollo Management International LLP as Arranger, the Original Additional Facility Lenders named therein, the Agent and the Security Agent on October 20, 2023 (the “Additional Term Facility Notice”); and (ii) an additional revolving facility notice under the Senior Facilities Agreement with, among others, the Original Additional Revolving Facility Lenders named therein, the Agent and the Security Agent on October 29, 2023 (the “Additional Revolving Facilities Notice”). The Additional Term Facility Notice provided for a senior term loan in a principal amount of £683,903,176 (the “Private Placement Facility”). The Additional Revolving Facilities Notice provided for (i) an additional revolving facility 1 in principal amount of £117,272,727 (the “Additional Revolving Facility 1”); and (ii) an additional revolving facility 2 in principal amount of £50,000,000 (the “Additional Revolving Facility 2”, and together with Additional Revolving Facility 1, the “Additional Revolving Facilities”), which form part of the Original Revolving Facility. On or around the Issue Date, the Senior Facilities Agreement is expected to be further amended and restated via an amendment and restatement agreement, to amend certain terms thereof to reflect certain terms of the Senior Secured Notes and to establish the Senior Facilities as at the Issue Date. Facility B (EUR) will be utilised on or around the Issue Date and the proceeds of such utilisation will be applied (directly or indirectly) in or towards financing outstanding amounts under the Original Facility B and any other senior secured indebtedness of the Group. New Facility A will also be established on or around the Issue Date by way of redesignating part of the commitments and outstanding amounts under the Original Facility A as commitments and loans thereunder, thereby effecting a maturity extension of the commitments of consenting lenders. New Revolving Facility will also be established on or around the Issue Date and to the extent that any amounts are drawn under the Original Revolving Facility as at the Issue Date will be utilised (directly or indirectly) in or towards refinancing the outstanding amounts under the Original Revolving Facility; the commitments under the Original Revolving Facility will be cancelled and replaced with the commitments under the New Revolving Facility thereby effecting a maturity extension of the commitments of consenting lenders. In addition to the Senior Facilities, the Senior Facilities Agreement includes (subject to the limitation on indebtedness covenant and permissions thereunder) the ability to establish an additional facility (“Additional

Subsubsection Text: All amounts borrowed under Original Facility A and Original Facility B were applied (directly or indirectly) in or towards: (i) satisfaction of the consideration payable for the LBO Acquisition (including any interest payments, completion account-related adjustments and purchase price adjustments (however structured)) and any other amounts payable under the Acquisition Documents (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) in connection with the LBO Acquisition; (ii) refinancing or otherwise discharging any existing indebtedness of the Asda Group (including backstopping or providing cash-cover in respect of any letters of credit, guarantees, performance bonds or ancillary, revolving, working capital or local facilities or other arrangements) and paying any related breakage costs, redemption premium, make-whole costs and other fees, costs and expenses payable in connection with such refinancing, discharge and/or the LBO Acquisition; (iii) financing or refinancing the payment of any transaction costs or paying any other related fees, costs and expenses; and/or (iv) making any payments contemplated by the Tax Structure Memorandum, the Funds Flow Statement (each as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) or any other documents relating to the Transactions (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement). All amounts borrowed under the Additional Term Facility were applied (directly or indirectly) in or towards: (i) satisfaction of the consideration payable for the EG UK Acquisition (including any interest payments, completion account related adjustments and purchase price adjustments (however structured)) and any other amounts payable under the America acquisition agreement for the EG UK Acquisition; (ii) financing or refinancing the payment of any acquisition costs as well as any other related fees, costs and expenses in connection with the EG UK Acquisition; and/or (iii) making any payments contemplated by the tax structure memorandum or the funds flow statement, in each case in connection with the EG UK Acquisition. All amounts borrowed under the New Facility A are expected to be applied (directly or indirectly) in or towards (i) financing or otherwise discharging part of the outstanding amounts under the Original Facility A and (ii) financing or refinancing the payment of any transaction costs or paying any other related fees, costs and expenses. All amounts established under the Facility B (EUR) will be applied (directly or indirectly) in or towards (i) financing or otherwise discharging part or all of the outstanding amounts under the Original Facility B, (ii) financing or otherwise discharging certain other Senior Secured Indebtedness of the Group, and (iii) financing or refinancing the payment of any transaction costs or paying any other related fees, costs and expenses. The New Revolving Facility may be used for financing or refinancing: (A) the prepayment of all or any part of any amounts then outstanding under the applicable existing senior facilities (including the payment of any accrued interest and/or the payment of any fees, costs and expenses incurred in connection therewith and in connection with the new Senior Facilities) in order to effect an extension to the maturity date of such facilities, together with the refinancing of any other senior secured indebtedness of the Group (including the payment of any accrued interest and/or the payment of any fees, costs and expenses incurred in connection therewith); (B) the general corporate purposes and/or working capital requirements of the Group (including, without limitation, the financing or refinancing 214 ----- of capital expenditure, any permitted acquisitions, investments, joint-ventures, restructuring costs, operational restructurings and reorganisation requirements of the Group); (C) the financial indebtedness of the Group or any acquired target group; and (D) certain fees, costs and expenses.

Subsubsection Text: The Senior Facilities Agreement will permit voluntary prepayments to be made (subject to _de minimis amounts), and will require mandatory prepayment in full or in part in certain circumstances, including: - from certain net cash proceeds received by the Group from certain asset disposals, to the extent not otherwise applied for a permitted purpose and required to be applied in prepayment of the Senior Facilities and subject to a de minimis amount (an “Asset Sale Prepayment”); and - unless otherwise agreed by the majority lenders under the Senior Facilities Agreement, for each financial year (commencing with the first full financial year commencing after the Alaska Closing Date), a percentage of excess cash flow in the event that excess cash flow exceeds the aggregate of a minimum threshold amount and the deductible amount, which percentage decreases as the Senior Secured Net Leverage Ratio decreases (an “Excess Cash Flow Prepayment”). In addition, upon the occurrence of a Change of Control (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement), at the Senior Secured Notes Issuer’s option (in its sole discretion) unless otherwise agreed by the majority lenders under the Senior Facilities Agreement, either: (i) all outstanding undrawn commitments of each lender under the Senior Facilities Agreement shall be immediately cancelled and outstanding utilisations, together with accrued interest, shall become immediately due and payable; or (ii) each lender under the Senior Facilities Agreement shall be entitled to cancel its commitments and require prepayment of its share of outstanding utilisations within a prescribed time period. A Change of Control shall include: - any person or group (other than one or more of the Permitted Holders, as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) becoming the beneficial owner of more than 50% of the voting power of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, subject to certain conditions; and - the sale, lease, transfer, conveyance or other disposition of all or substantially all of the assets of the Group, subject to certain exceptions. At the election of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, amounts required to be prepaid pursuant to an Excess Cash Flow Prepayment or Asset Sale Prepayment may instead be applied in prepayment of (i) other Senior Secured Indebtedness (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) pro rata across such facilities, or (ii) provided that such application would comply with applicable limitations on restricted payments (see “—Covenants”), any other Permitted Indebtedness (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement). 217 -----

Subsubsection Text: _Guarantor Coverage Test and Material Subsidiaries_ The Senior Facilities are guaranteed by each borrower and guarantor of the Senior Facilities. Certain entities of the Group (being Asda Group Limited, Asda Stores Limited, McLagan Investments Limited, The Burwood House Group Limited and Euro Garages Limited) are obligors under the Senior Facilities Agreement and, subject to the Agreed Security Principles and any applicable guarantee limitations, guaranteed the Senior Facilities under the Senior Facilities Agreement and have granted security (subject to the Agreed Security Principles) in favour of the lenders under the Senior Facilities Agreement in respect of the Senior Facilities. Subject to the Agreed Security Principles in the Senior Facilities Agreement, the following security was granted as conditions precedent to the availability of the Senior Facilities on the Alaska Closing Date: (a) the Senior Notes Issuer granted a limited recourse share charge over the shares of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer; (b) the Senior Notes Issuer granted a limited recourse assignment by way of security over any material intra-group receivables owed to the Senior Notes Issuer by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer; and (c) the Senior Secured Notes Issuer granted a debenture comprising (i) assignment by way of security of material intra-group receivables owed to the Senior Secured Notes Issuer by any member of the Group, (ii) security over the Senior Secured Notes Issuer’s material bank accounts (without control over use) located in England and Wales and (iii) floating charge over all or substantially all of its assets (other than customarily excluded assets). On the LBO Acquisition Completion Date, the following security was also granted (together with the security package described immediately above, collectively the “Alaska Closing Date

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING ARRANGEMENTS
Subsection Title: Termination Date”), provided that to the extent the Senior Secured Notes Issuer and/or another member of the Group
Subsubsection Text: incurs any Senior Secured Indebtedness, Pari passu Indebtedness, Second Lien Lender Liabilities or Subordinated Indebtedness (including Topco Liabilities) after the Additional Facility Commencement Date (as defined in the Addition Term Facility Notice) and such Indebtedness has an initial maturity date on or prior to the date falling 6 months after the Original Termination Date, the Termination Date of the Additional Term Facility shall be (subject to certain exceptions) automatically deemed to be the date which falls 6 months prior to the initial maturity date of such other Indebtedness, subject to certain exceptions. In respect of the New Revolving Facility, each advance will be repaid on the last day of the interest period relating thereto, subject to an ability to roll over cash drawings. All outstanding amounts under the New Revolving Facility will be repaid on the Termination Date applicable to the New Revolving Facility, being October 16, 2028 subject to the springing maturity feature described below. Amounts repaid by the borrowers on loans made under the New Revolving Facility may be reborrowed during the Availability Period, subject to certain conditions. 216 ----- The New Revolving Facility shall include a springing maturity feature such that its maturity will be adjusted to: (a) 91 days inside the maturity of the Existing Senior Notes, if, as at the date that is 4 months prior to the current maturity date of the Existing Senior Notes, such Existing Senior Notes have not been repaid or refinanced or extended, in each case, to a date which is no earlier than the date which is 91 days from the initial maturity date for the New Revolving Facility but excluding for these purposes Existing Senior Notes up to an aggregate principal amount equal to £350,000,000 (or its equivalent in other currencies); and/or (b) 91 days inside the maturity of the Existing Senior Secured Notes and the Original Facility B, if, as at the date that is 4 months prior to the current maturity date of such earlier maturing Indebtedness, such Indebtedness has not been repaid or refinanced or extended, in each case, to a date which is no earlier than the date which is 91 days from the initial maturity date for the New Revolving Facility but excluding for these purposes any such Indebtedness up to an aggregate principal amount equal to £500,000,000 (or its equivalent in other currencies) and in addition, an amount of such Existing Senior Secured Notes equal to the amount of cash proceeds from the incurrence of new Indebtedness on or about the Issue Date that have been deposited into bank accounts with a view to being used for the future redemption or repayment of such Existing Senior Secured Notes.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING ARRANGEMENTS
Subsection Title: Security”): first-priority security interests over (a) the issued share capital of Asda Group Limited and Asda Stores
Subsubsection Text: Limited, (b) the material intercompany receivables owed to Asda Group Limited and Asda Stores Limited (not including any vendor loans, vendor notes or other similar vendor finance instruments whereby the transferor under any one or more transfers of Warehouse Assets or balances credited to the Designated Bank Accounts from members of the Group to Propco 2 or one or more parents, completed prior to November 5, 2021 in exchange for no consideration or for consideration left outstanding has deferred or may defer receipt of consideration owing to it by the transferee thereunder), (c) the material bank accounts (without control over use) located in England and Wales of Asda Group Limited and Asda Stores Limited, not including the Designated Bank Accounts, and (d) a floating charge over all or substantially all of the assets (other than any customarily excluded assets) of Asda Group Limited and Asda Stores Limited. Subject to the Agreed Security Principles in the Senior Facilities Agreement, on May 17, 2021, McLagan Investments Limited and The Burwood House Group Limited acceded to the Senior Facilities Agreement as guarantors and delivered certain conditions subsequent deliverables, consisting of (i) first-priority security interests over (a) all the issued capital stock of McLagan Investments Limited and The Burwood House Group Limited, (b) the material intercompany receivables owed to McLagan Investments Limited and The Burwood House Group Limited (not including any vendor loans, vendor notes or other similar vendor finance instruments whereby the transferor under any one or more transfers of Warehouse Assets or balances credited to the Designated Bank Accounts from members of the Group to Propco 2 or one or more parents, completed prior to November 5, 2021 in exchange for no consideration or for consideration left outstanding has deferred or may defer receipt of consideration owing to it by the transferee thereunder), and (c) the material bank accounts (without control over use) located in England and Wales of McLagan Investments Limited and The Burwood House Group Limited (not including the Designated Bank Accounts), and (ii) a floating charge over all or substantially all assets of McLagan Investments Limited and The Burwood House Group Limited (other than customarily excluded assets) (collectively, the “Alaska Post-Closing

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING ARRANGEMENTS
Subsubsection Text: The Senior Facilities Agreement contains certain representations and warranties (subject to certain agreed qualifications and with certain representations being repeated), including: (i) status, (ii) binding obligations, (iii) non-conflict with other obligations, (iv) power and authority, (v) validity and admissibility in evidence, (vi) governing law and enforcement, (vii) filings, (viii) no default, (ix) no misleading information in relation to the information memorandum, the financial model relating to the Group and certain diligence reports provided, (x) financial statements, (xi) no litigation, (xii) environmental laws, (xiii) taxation, (xiv) pari passu ranking, (xv) ownership, (xvi) acquisition documents, (xvii) intellectual property, (xviii) group structure chart and (xix) anti-corruption law / sanctions. Certain representations and warranties were made on the date of the Senior Facilities Agreement and the Alaska Closing Date and at certain other times, and certain representations and warranties will be repeated on the date of each utilisation request, the date of each utilisation, on the first day of each interest period.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING ARRANGEMENTS
Subsubsection Text: The Senior Facilities Agreement contains certain incurrence covenants, information undertakings and related definitions (with, in each case, certain adjustments), including (i) a requirement to deliver copies of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer’s audited annual consolidated financial statements to the Agent (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) within 120 days after the end of each of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer’s fiscal years; (ii) a requirement to deliver the Senior Secured Notes Issuer’s consolidated financial statements within 60 days of the end of each of its first three fiscal quarters in each fiscal year; (iii) limitations on indebtedness; (iv) limitations on restricted payments; (v) limitations on liens (which includes restrictions on designating indebtedness secured on the Collateral as Super Senior Liabilities (as defined in the section entitled “Description of Certain Financing Arrangements—Intercreditor _Agreement”)); (vi) limitations on restrictions on distributions from restricted subsidiaries; (vii) limitations on sales of_ assets and subsidiary stock; (viii) limitations on affiliate transactions; (ix) merger and consolidation; (x) impairment of security interest, and (xi) limitations on sale and leaseback transactions, ground rent transactions and qualified securitization financings involving real property, which are (or will be with effect from the Issue Date and the amendment and restatement of the Senior Facilities Agreement) in each case substantially the same as the corresponding covenants under the Senior Secured Notes. In addition, the Senior Facilities Agreement also requires the Senior Secured Notes Issuer and certain of its restricted subsidiaries to observe certain other customary positive and negative covenants, subject to certain exceptions and grace periods, including covenants relating to: (i) authorisations and consents; (ii) compliance with laws; (iii) pari passu_ ranking; (iv) payment of taxes; (v) centre of main interests; (vi) provision of guarantees and security; (vii) further assurance; (viii) compliance with anti-corruption laws and sanctions; (ix) ratings; and (x) investigations when a Material Event of Default (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) is continuing. The Senior Facilities Agreement also contains certain provisions facilitating an IPO debt pushdown (see “—Intercreditor Agreement— _Required Consents—Provisions Following an IPO”)._ 220 ----- Solely for the benefit of the lenders participating in the Additional Term Facility, the Additional Term Facility Notice contains certain additional covenants and/or restrictions on the Group. Solely for the benefit of the lenders participating in a Financial Covenant Facility (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement), the Senior Facilities Agreement requires that, in the event that the aggregate amount of all cash loans drawn under all Financial Covenant Facilities (excluding any ancillary facilities and any utilisations of the Financial Covenant Facilities by way of letters of credit (or bank guarantees)), any amounts utilised to fund any original issue discount or flex related payments, fees or expenses or made on the Alaska Closing Date(and any rollover loans in respect of such utilisations), less any cash and cash equivalents of the Group, exceeds 40% of the aggregate of (i) the total commitments under the Revolving Credit Facility as at the original date of the Senior Facilities Agreement (as reduced to reflect the cancellation in full and termination of the Original Revolving Facility 2 Commitments thereafter) and (ii) the aggregate commitments under any additional revolving facility established after the original date of the Senior Facilities Agreement (including the Additional Revolving Facilities), on the relevant testing date (the “Revolving Test Condition”), the Consolidated Senior Secured Net Leverage Ratio does not exceed 4.90:1 (the “Financial Covenant”). The Consolidated Senior Secured Net Leverage Ratio is based on the definitions and adjustments in the Senior Facilities Agreement, which may differ from similar definitions in the Indenture and the equivalent definitions described in this Offering Memorandum. The Senior Facilities Agreement contains an equity cure provision enabling the shareholders of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer to make shareholder injections by way of subordinated shareholder debt and/or equity to the Senior Secured Notes Issuer to (i) increase Consolidated EBITDA as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement (an “EBITDA Cure”), (ii) decrease Consolidated Senior Secured Net Debt as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement (a “Net Debt Cure”), or (iii) repay or prepay or net off against any outstanding loans or (at the election of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer) any cash drawings outstanding under any ancillary facility, in each case so that the Revolving Test Condition is no longer met. The EBITDA Cure right may not be exercised on more than five occasions during the term of the Senior Facilities. No more than two cure rights (which are either EBITDA Cures or Net Debt Cures) may be exercised in three consecutive financial quarters. It is intended that certain agreed covenants and other provisions of the Senior Facilities Agreement will fall away on the satisfaction of certain release conditions, being (i) a listing has occurred which does not constitute a Change of Control and the Consolidated Net Leverage Ratio (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) for the relevant period is equal to or less than 2.70:1, (ii) the long-term corporate credit rating of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer (or, as the case may be, any holding company of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer) is equal to or better than Baa3 according to Moody’s or BBB- according to S&P and no Default or Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, or (iii) Facility B (EUR) has achieved and maintained Investment Grade Status (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) and no Default or Event of Default has occurred and is continuing.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING ARRANGEMENTS
Subsubsection Text: The Senior Facilities Agreement provides (or will provide with effect from the Issue Date and the amendment and restatement of the Senior Facilities Agreement) for substantially the same events of default as under the Senior Secured Notes. In addition, the Senior Facilities Agreement provides for additional events of default, subject to customary materiality qualifications and grace periods, including (i) (for the benefit of the lenders participating in a Financial Covenant Facility only) breach of the financial covenant; (ii) inaccuracy of a representation or statement when made; (iii) invalidity and unlawfulness of the Finance documents (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement); and (iv) material failure to comply with the Intercreditor Agreement.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING ARRANGEMENTS
Subsubsection Text: The Senior Facilities Agreement and any non-contractual obligations arising out of or in connection with it, are governed by, construed in accordance with and will be enforced in accordance with English law, although the information undertakings, restrictive covenants, events of default and related definitions scheduled to the Senior Facilities Agreement will be interpreted in accordance with New York law (without prejudice to the fact that the Senior Facilities Agreement is governed by English law). 221 -----

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING ARRANGEMENTS
Subsubsection Text: Subject to the Agreed Security Principles in the Senior Facilities Agreement, on August 13, 2021, September 20, 2021, October 21, 2021 and May 4, 2022, the Guarantors delivered certain conditions subsequent deliverables, consisting of first-priority security interests over Material Real Property (as such term is defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement, which excludes the Warehouse Assets, the Select Retail Assets and the Substitute Retail Assets) situated in England and Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland pursuant to the terms of the Senior Facilities Agreement. Subject to the Agreed Security Principles in the Senior Facilities Agreement, on November 5, 2021, the Guarantors and certain third-party security providers delivered a supplemental security agreement in relation to the Alaska Closing Date Security and the Alaska Post-Closing Date Security. 218 ----- Subject to the Agreed Security Principles in the Senior Facilities Agreement, on October 29, 2023, the Guarantors and certain third party security providers delivered a second supplemental security agreement in relation to the Alaska Closing Date Security and the Alaska Post-Closing Date Security in accordance with the terms of the Additional Term Facility Notice and on November 1, 2023, Project America Bidco Limited delivered certain condition subsequent deliverables, consisting of a share pledge and receivables assignment agreement over (a) the shares it owns in Euro Garages (Jersey) Limited and (b) any material receivables owed to it by Euro Garages (Jersey) Limited or any member of the America Target Group (as defined in the Additional Term Facility Notice), in each case on a third party limited recourse basis. Subject to the Agreed Security Principles in the Senior Facilities Agreement, following the EG UK Acquisition, on January 26, 2024, Euro Garages Limited acceded to the Senior Facilities Agreement as a guarantor and delivered certain conditions subsequent deliverables, consisting of (i) first-priority security interests over (a) the material intercompany receivables owed to Euro Garages Limited, and (b) the material bank accounts (without control over use) located in England and Wales of Euro Garages Limited, and (ii) a floating charge over all or substantially all assets of Euro Garages Limited (other than customarily excluded assets). In addition, on such date Euro Garages (Jersey) Limited granted a first-priority security interest over all the issued capital stock of and material intercompany receivables owed to it by Euro Garages Limited on a third party limited recourse basis. Subject to the Agreed Security Principles, supplemental legal mortgages will be granted over the Material Real Properties (such security to be completed on or prior to April 24, 2024). The security package described in this paragraph, together with the security package delivered by Project America Bidco Limited as described in the paragraph immediately above, shall collectively constitute the “America Post-Closing Date Security”). It is expected that on or around the Issue Date (or within the time periods agreed thereafter), in connection with the amendment and restatement of the Senior Facilities Agreement and the establishment of certain Senior Facilities thereunder, further supplemental security, including legal mortgages granted over Material Real Property (as such term is defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement which excludes the Warehouse Assets, the Select Retail Assets and the Substitute Retail Assets) situated in England and Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland pursuant to the terms of the Senior Facilities Agreement, shall be granted in respect of the Alaska Closing Date Security, the Alaska Post-Closing Date Security and the America Post-Closing Date Security. Subject to certain adjustments and the Agreed Security Principles, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer is required to ensure that members of the Group incorporated in the United Kingdom, any jurisdiction of incorporation of a Material Subsidiary and any jurisdiction of incorporation of a Borrower (each as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) (each, a “Security Jurisdiction”) that generate at least 80% of Consolidated EBITDA (as defined in the section entitled “Description of the Senior Secured Notes”) and that hold at least 80% of the aggregate gross assets of the members of the Group incorporated in a Security Jurisdiction are guarantors (the “Guarantor Coverage Test”) under the Senior Facilities Agreement within 90 days after the date on which the annual financial statements of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer are required to be delivered to the Agent under the Senior Facilities Agreement from time to time. Security granted by the obligors shall, pursuant to the Agreed Security Principles, be limited to security over such obligor’s (a) material bank accounts (without control over use) located in a Security Jurisdiction, (b) shares owned by such obligor in other Material Subsidiaries (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) which are Guarantors, (c) material intercompany receivables owed to such obligor by other members of the Group, and (d) all asset floating charge security (other than customarily excluded assets) to the extent it is customary to grant such security in the jurisdiction of incorporation of such obligor, provided that no other security (other than the Alaska Closing Date Security, Alaska Post-Closing Date Security and America Post-Closing Date Security already granted) shall be required to be given by any other member of the Group or in relation to any other asset unless specifically otherwise requested or agreed to by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer (in its absolute discretion) provided further that limited recourse third-party share security over the shares in Material Subsidiaries (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) shall be granted by the direct holding companies of such Material Subsidiaries (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement). _Release of Guarantees and Security_ In addition to the circumstances described below under “Intercreditor Agreement—Distressed Disposals” and “Intercreditor Agreement—Non-Distressed Disposals,” the Senior Secured Notes Issuer may, subject to certain 219 ----- conditions, request the release of a Guarantor from its guarantee under the Senior Facilities Agreement if (i) such Guarantor is the subject of a third-party disposal, becomes a member of the Regulated Group (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) or is the subject of other permitted activity under the Senior Facilities Agreement pursuant to which such Guarantor will cease to be a member of the Group, (ii) on a pro forma basis taking into account such release, the Guarantor Coverage Test will continue to be satisfied, (iii) the lenders whose commitments under the Senior Facilities Agreement aggregate 80% or more of the total commitments under such facilities have consented to the resignation of that Guarantor, (iv) if the resignation is contemplated by the Tax Structure Memorandum (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) or (v) the release is otherwise expressly permitted by or contemplated (or otherwise approved) under the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement or any additional intercreditor agreement. Upon the effectiveness of a release pursuant to the foregoing sentence, the applicable Guarantor would have no further obligations under the Finance Documents, including any obligations to grant Security in any Collateral owned by such Guarantor. The provision and the terms of the security and guarantees set forth above will in all cases be subject to certain limitations and are at all times and in all cases subject to the requirements of applicable law and the other matters set forth in the Intercreditor Agreement and the Senior Facilities Agreement.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING ARRANGEMENTS
Subsubsection Text: To establish the relative rights of certain of our creditors under our financing arrangements, the Senior Notes Issuer and the Senior Secured Notes Issuer entered into an intercreditor agreement on February 12, 2021 (the “Intercreditor Agreement”) with, among others, the Security Agent and the agents, arrangers and lenders under the Senior Facilities Agreement. Deutsche Trustee Company Limited, in its capacity as trustee under the Senior Notes Indenture, acceded to the Intercreditor Agreement as a Topco Notes Trustee (as defined in the Intercreditor Agreement) on February 24, 2021. Asda Stores Limited and Asda Group Limited acceded to the Intercreditor Agreement on the LBO Acquisition Completion Date and McLagan Investments Limited and The Burwood House Group Limited acceded to the Intercreditor Agreement on May 17, 2021. The Senior Secured Notes Trustee is expected to accede to the Intercreditor Agreement as a Senior Secured Notes Trustee (as defined in the Intercreditor Agreement) on or about the Issue Date of the Senior Secured Notes. On or about the Issue Date of the Senior Secured Notes, the Senior Secured Notes will be designated “Senior Secured Notes” under and pursuant to the Intercreditor Agreement. By accepting a Senior Secured Note, holders of the Senior Secured Notes will be deemed to have agreed to, and accepted the terms and conditions of, the Intercreditor Agreement. The Intercreditor Agreement is governed by English law and sets out various matters governing the relationship of the creditors to our group including the relative ranking of certain debt of the Senior Notes Issuer, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, the Guarantors and any other person that becomes party to the Intercreditor Agreement as a Debtor or Third-Party Security Provider, when payments can be made in respect of debt of the Debtors or Third-Party Security Providers, when enforcement action can be taken in respect of that debt, the terms pursuant to which certain of that debt will be subordinated upon the occurrence of certain insolvency events and turnover provisions and provisions related to the enforcement of shared security. The following description is a summary of certain provisions to be contained in the Intercreditor Agreement. It does not restate the Intercreditor Agreement in its entirety and we urge you to read that document because it, and not the discussion that follows, defines certain rights of the holders of the Senior Secured Notes and of the Senior Secured Notes Trustee. Capitalised terms used in this section “—Intercreditor Agreement” but not defined herein have the meanings given to them in the Intercreditor Agreement. For the purposes of this description: References to the “Senior Secured Notes” shall include the Existing Senior Secured Notes, the Senior Secured Notes or any additional notes issued from time to time under the Existing Senior Secured Notes Indentures and the Senior Secured Notes Indenture, and any other notes, securities or other debt instruments issued or to be issued by, or in relation to which a New Debt Financing (as defined below) has been made available to or by, a member of the Group which are designated by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer as Senior Secured Notes under the Intercreditor Agreement, and references to the “Topco Notes” shall include the Existing Senior Notes, any additional notes issued from time to time under the Existing Senior Notes Indenture, and any other notes, securities or other debt instruments issued or to be issued by, or in relation to which a New Debt Financing has been made available to or by, a Topco Borrower (as defined below) which are designated by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer as Topco Notes. The Intercreditor Agreement uses the term the “Company” to refer to the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, “Topco” to refer to the Senior Notes Issuer and “Senior Secured Notes Liabilities” to refer to the Senior Secured Notes and certain other indebtedness of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING ARRANGEMENTS
Subsubsection Text: _Priority of Debts_ The Intercreditor Agreement provides that the liabilities owed by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer and each other debtor under the Intercreditor Agreement (together, the “Debtors”) (other than the Senior Notes Issuer or any other member of the Group which is designated as a Topco Borrower under the Intercreditor Agreement (a “Topco 222 -----

Subsubsection Text: “Second Lien Lender Liabilities”), (viii) any second lien notes trustee (other than certain amounts paid to it in its capacity as trustee), the holders of any future second lien notes and the Security Agent in relation to any second lien notes (such second lien notes being “Second Lien Notes” and the liabilities in respect of such Second Lien Notes being the “Second Lien Notes Liabilities” and together with the Second Lien Lender Liabilities, the “Second Lien Liabilities”), (ix) any arranger in respect of any Senior Liabilities, Senior Secured Liabilities, Second Liabilities or Topco Liabilities (the “Arranger Liabilities”), (x) any agent or trustee under any finance documents relating to any of the aforementioned liabilities, any agent or trustee under the Topco Liabilities (as defined below) and to any agent or trustee in relation to certain other unsecured liabilities (together, the “Agent Liabilities”) and (xi) the Security Agent, pari passu and without any preference between them; and (ii) second, all liabilities owed (i) to the Trustee under the Existing Senior Notes Indenture and any trustee in relation to any future Topco Notes (other than certain amounts paid to them in their capacity as trustee), the holders of the Existing Senior Notes and the holders of any future notes issued by or in relation to which a New Debt Financing has been made available to or by a Topco Borrower and designated by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer as Topco Notes, and the Security Agent in relation to the Existing Senior Notes and any other Topco Notes (the “Topco Notes Liabilities”), (ii) under or in connection with any future loan facility made available to any Topco Borrower (a “Topco Loan”) (the “Topco Facility Liabilities” and together with the Topco Notes Liabilities, the “Topco Liabilities”), and (iii) the liabilities owed under or in connection with the Senior Financing Proceeds Loan and any future loan (each, a “Topco Proceeds Loan”) made by any Topco Borrower for the purpose of on-lending the proceeds of any Topco Notes or Topco Loans (the “Topco

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING ARRANGEMENTS
Subsection Title: Proceeds Loan Liabilities”), pari passu and without any preference between them.
Subsubsection Text: The Intercreditor Agreement provides that the liabilities owed by any Topco Borrower to the Secured Parties (as defined below) shall rank pari passu in right and priority of payment and without any preference between them in respect of (i) the Senior Lender Liabilities, (ii) the Super Senior Liabilities, (iii) the Senior Secured Notes Liabilities, (iv) the Cash Management Facility Liabilities, (v) the Hedging Liabilities, (vi) the Second Lien Lender Liabilities, 223 ----- (vii) the Second Lien Notes Liabilities, (viii) the Topco Liabilities, (ix) the Topco Proceeds Loan Liabilities, (x) the Agent Liabilities, and (xi) the Arranger Liabilities. The Intercreditor Agreement provides that the intra-group liabilities owed by one member of the Group (other than a member of the Regulated Group (as defined in the Intercreditor Agreement)) to another member of the Group (other than any Subordinated Liabilities (as defined below), Senior Secured Notes Proceeds Loan Liabilities or Topco Proceeds Loan Liabilities) (the “Intra-Group Liabilities”) will be subordinated to the liabilities owed by the Debtors and (only to the extent it has expressly assumed any such liabilities or obligations) the Third-Party Security Providers to the creditors under the Senior Lender Liabilities, Super Senior Liabilities, Senior Secured Notes Liabilities, Cash Management Facility Liabilities, Hedging Liabilities, Second Lien Lender Liabilities and Second Lien Notes Liabilities, Agent Liabilities, Topco Liabilities and Topco Proceeds Loan Liabilities (such creditors, together with the Security Agent, any receiver or delegate and any arranger with respect to the Secured Liabilities, the “Secured

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING ARRANGEMENTS
Subsubsection Text: The Intercreditor Agreement provides, subject to certain conditions, for the implementation of existing, additional, supplemental or new financing arrangements or the assumption or incurrence of any liabilities that will constitute, for the purposes of the Intercreditor Agreement, Senior Lender Liabilities, Senior Secured Notes Liabilities, Cash Management Facility Liabilities, Hedging Liabilities, Second Lien Liabilities, Topco Liabilities, Super Senior Liabilities or unsecured liabilities subject to the Intercreditor Agreement (each, a “New Debt Financing”). The conditions include certification by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer that such New Debt Financing is not prohibited under the terms of the Finance Documents. Such financing arrangements may be implemented by way of refinancing, replacement, exchange, set-off, discharge or increase of any such new, existing, additional or supplemental financing, guarantee or debt arrangement under the relevant finance documents. In connection with and in order to facilitate any New Debt Financing, each agent and the Security Agent (and each other person party to a Transaction Security document or a Topco Independent Transaction Security document) is authorised and instructed to promptly enter into any new security document, amend or waive any term of an existing security document and/or release any asset from the Transaction Security or Topco Independent Transaction Security (as the case may be) subject to certain conditions, including as regards the terms of such security (which shall be, unless otherwise agreed by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer or otherwise required by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, substantially the same as the terms applicable to the existing Transaction Security or Topco Independent Transaction Security over equivalent assets). Where any indebtedness (“Permitted Acquired Indebtedness”) which is not prohibited under the Finance Documents is incurred by or in connection with the acquisition of (i) a person or any of its subsidiaries who, after the Effective Date, becomes a Restricted Subsidiary or merges, consolidates or is otherwise combined with a Restricted Subsidiary, or (ii) in relation to an asset of any such person or which is otherwise acquired after the Effective Date (together, an “Acquired Person or Asset”), any security, guarantee, indemnity or other assurance against loss in respect of such New Debt Financing which is subsisting at the date when the conditions to the incurrence of such New Debt Financing set out in the Intercreditor Agreement have been satisfied (or is to be granted thereafter, including 226 ----- subject to any condition or periodic testing) shall be permitted to subsist (or to be granted) and there is no requirement to offer that security, guarantee, indemnity or other assurance in respect of any other liabilities under any Debt Document. No security, guarantee, indemnity or other assurance against loss is required to be given by any member of the Topco Group in respect of any liabilities (including under any Debt Document) (i) over any Acquired Person or Asset if this would breach a contractual undertaking applicable to the Topco Group or is excluded or exempt from being given under the Agreed Security Principles (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement), (ii) over any asset required (including subject to any condition) to provide credit support in relation to any Permitted Acquired Indebtedness (other than as a result of any obligation to extend any Transaction Security rateably for the benefit of such Permitted Acquired Indebtedness), or (iii) where the grant of such security, guarantee, indemnity or other assurance against loss is prevented by the documentation in relation to such Permitted Acquired Indebtedness or would give rise to an obligation (including any payment obligation but not including any obligation to extend any Transaction Security rateably for the benefit of such Permitted Acquired Indebtedness) under or in relation thereto.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING ARRANGEMENTS
Subsubsection Text: _Permitted Payments in Respect of the Senior and Super Senior Debt_ The Debtors and Third-Party Security Providers may make payment in respect of the Senior Lender Liabilities, Senior Secured Notes Liabilities, Super Senior Liabilities and Cash Management Facility Liabilities (together with the Hedging Liabilities, the “Senior Secured Creditor Liabilities,” the creditors in respect thereof being the “Senior Secured Creditors”) at any time, provided that following certain acceleration events under the Senior Secured Facilities Agreement, any Permitted Senior Secured Facilities Agreement, any Senior Secured Notes Indenture or Permitted Super Senior Secured Facilities Agreement or following certain insolvency events in relation to a member of the Group, payments may only be made by Debtors or Third-Party Security Providers and received by creditors in accordance with the provisions described below under “Application of Proceeds”; provided that after the Designation Date there shall be no obligation to turnover any such payments received, other than those related to an enforcement of Transaction Security or a Distressed Disposal (as defined below) of assets subject to the Transaction Security. Any failure to make a payment in accordance with the Senior Secured Finance Documents following an acceleration event or insolvency event as required by the Intercreditor Agreement shall not prevent the occurrence of an event of default under such applicable Senior Secured Finance Documents. _Permitted Payments in Respect of Second Lien Liabilities_ Prior to the date which is the later of the Super Senior Discharge Date and the Senior Secured Discharge Date, the Debtors, the Third-Party Security Providers and other members of the Group may only make specified payments (including any other direct or indirect step, matter, action or dealing in relation to any Second Lien Liabilities otherwise prohibited under the Intercreditor Agreement) under the Second Lien Liabilities to the Second Lien Creditors (such payments, collectively, “Permitted Second Lien Payments”): (i) if: (1) no Second Lien Payment Stop Notice (as defined below) is outstanding; (2) no payment default (subject to a de minimis threshold in the case of amounts other than principal, interest or certain fees) has occurred and is continuing under any Permitted Senior Secured Facilities Agreement, Permitted Super Senior Secured Facilities Agreement, Cash Management Facility document or Senior Secured Notes document (a “Senior Secured Payment Default”); and (3) the payment is (1) of any amount of principal or capitalised interest in respect of the Second Lien Liabilities which is not prohibited by any prior ranking financing agreements (in respect of the Senior Secured Liabilities), or, to the extent prohibited, any required consents to permit such payment have been obtained, (2) of any other amounts which is not an amount of principal or capitalised interest including all scheduled interest payments (including, if applicable, special interest or liquidated damages), the accrual of cash interest 227 ----- otherwise payable during a period when a Second Lien Payment Stop Notice (as defined below) is outstanding and default interest on the Second Lien Liabilities accrued and payable in accordance with the terms of the relevant Second Lien Finance Document (as at the date of the issue of the same or as amended in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement and the other Debt Documents), additional amounts payable as a result of the tax gross-up provisions relating to Second Lien Liabilities and amounts in respect of currency indemnities in any Second Lien Finance Document, (3) made in pursuance of a debt buy-back programme approved by the Majority Senior Secured Creditors and Majority Super Senior Creditors (each as defined below), or (4) amounts due under any syndication strategy letter relating to the Second Lien Finance Documents; (ii) if, notwithstanding that a Second Lien Payment Stop Notice (as defined below) is outstanding and/or (other than in respect of paragraph (L) below) a Senior Secured Payment Default has occurred and is continuing and irrespective of whether any creditors under prior ranking financing agreements have accelerated their debt or the payment is (without double-counting any equivalent applicable basket in any Debt Document, but whether or not permitted by the Debt Documents): (A) of ongoing fees under any original fee letter relating to the Second Lien Finance Documents, (B) of commercially reasonable advisory and professional fees for restructuring advice and valuations (including legal advice and the advice of other appropriate financial and/or restructuring advisors) and a Second Lien Creditor Representative’s fees, costs and expenses not exceeding €1,500,000 in aggregate, but excluding the costs of any litigation against a Senior Secured Creditor (or their affiliates), (C) of any amounts owed to a Second Lien Agent (as defined below), (D) of costs necessary to protect, preserve or enforce security, (E) of any costs, commissions, taxes, premiums, amendment fees (including any original issue discount and other consent and/or waiver fees) and any expenses incurred in respect of (or reasonably incidental to) the Second Lien Finance Documents (including in relation to any reporting or listing requirements under the Second Lien Finance Documents), (F) of any other amount not exceeding €4,000,000 (equivalent) in aggregate in any 12-month period, (G) of any amount of the Second Lien Liabilities which would have been payable but for the issue of a Second Lien Payment Stop Notice (which has since expired and where no new Second Lien Payment Stop Notice is outstanding) which has been capitalised and added to the principal amount of the Second Lien Liabilities or where that amount is outstanding as a result of the accrual of cash interest payable in respect of the Second Lien Liabilities during such period or any such amount described at (i)(C) above, provided that no such payment may be made if certain events of default have occurred or would occur as a result of making such payment, (H) for as long as an event of default under the Senior Secured Liabilities or Second Lien Liabilities is continuing, of all or part of the Second Lien Liabilities being released or otherwise discharged solely in consideration for the issues of shares in any holding company of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer or Topco (a “Debt for Equity Swap”) provided that no cash or cash equivalent payment is made in respect of the Second Lien Liabilities, that it does not result in a Change of Control (as defined in any prior ranking finance agreement) and that any liabilities under the Debt Documents owed by a member of the Group to another member of the Group, to the Subordinated Creditors or to any other holding company of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer that arise as a result of any such Debt for Equity Swap are subordinated to the Senior Secured Liabilities pursuant to the Intercreditor Agreement and the Senior Secured Creditors are granted Transaction Security in respect of any of those liabilities under the Debt Documents owed by any member of the Group to the extent such Transaction Security is required to be granted pursuant to the terms of the Secured Debt Documents, (I) of non-cash interest made by way of capitalising interest or issuing a non-cash-pay instrument which is subordinated to the Senior Secured Liabilities on the same terms as the Second Lien Liabilities, (J) if the payment is funded directly or indirectly with the proceeds of Second Lien Liabilities or Topco Liabilities incurred respectively under or pursuant to any Second Lien Finance Document and/or Topco Finance Document, (K) if the payment is of a principal amount of the Second Lien Liabilities and made in accordance with a provision in a Second Lien Finance Document relating to prepayment upon illegality or in relation to the prepayment of a single lender in the event of a tax gross-up, increased costs or other indemnity becoming payable and (L) if no Senior Secured Payment Default has occurred and is continuing and the payment is a payment of principal, interest or any other amounts made on or after the final maturity of the relevant Second Lien Liabilities 228 ----- (provided that such maturity date is no earlier than that contained in the original form of the relevant Second Lien Finance Document as of the first date of borrowing or issuance (as the case may be) of the applicable Second Lien Liabilities); or (iii) if the requisite Senior Secured Creditors and Super Senior Creditors give prior consent to that payment being made. On or after the later of the Super Senior Discharge Date and the Senior Secured Discharge Date, the Debtors and the Third-Party Security Providers may make payments in respect of the Second Lien Liabilities in accordance with the Second Lien Finance Documents. _Second Lien Liabilities Payment Block Provisions_ A Second Lien Payment Stop Notice (as defined below) is outstanding from the date on which, following the occurrence of certain material events of default, the Security Agent (acting on the instructions of the requisite Super Senior Creditors or Senior Secured Creditors gave the instructions for the relevant stop notice to be delivered) (a “Second Lien Payment Stop Notice”) to the Second Lien Creditor Representative(s) advising that the relevant event of default is continuing and suspending payments of the Second Lien Liabilities, until the first to occur of: (i) the date falling 120 days after delivery of that Second Lien Payment Stop Notice; (ii) the date on which a default occurs for failure to pay principal at the original scheduled maturity of the relevant Second Lien Liabilities; (iii) if a Second Lien Standstill Period (as defined below) commences after delivery of that Second Lien Payment Stop Notice, the date on which such standstill period expires; (iv) the date on which the relevant material event of default has been remedied or waived; (v) the date on which the Security Agent (acting on the instructions of whichever of the Super Senior Creditors or Senior Secured Creditors gave the instructions for the relevant stop notice to be delivered) delivers a notice to the Senior Secured Notes Issuer and the Second Lien Creditor Representative cancelling the payment stop notice; (vi) the later of the Super Senior Discharge Date and the Senior Secured Discharge Date; and (vii) the date on which the Second Lien Creditors take any enforcement action that they are permitted under the Intercreditor Agreement (see “Enforcement Regime—Permitted Second Lien _Enforcement” below)._ No Second Lien Payment Stop Notice may be delivered by the Security Agent in reliance on a particular relevant event of default more than 45 days after the occurrence of the relevant event of default. No more than one Second Lien Payment Stop Notice may be served (i) with respect to the same event or set of circumstances or (ii) in any period of 360 days. Any failure to make a payment due in respect of the Second Lien Liabilities as a result of the issue of a Second Lien Payment Stop Notice or the occurrence of a Senior Secured Payment Default shall not prevent (i) the occurrence of an event of default as a consequence of that failure to make a payment in relation to the relevant Second Lien Liabilities or (ii) the issue of an enforcement notice in respect of an event of default under the finance documents documenting any Second Lien Liabilities (a “Second Lien Enforcement Notice”) on behalf of the Second Lien Creditors. _Payment Obligations and Capitalisation of Interest Continue_ Nothing in the Second Lien or Topco payment block provisions will release any Debtor or Third-Party Security Provider from the liability to make any payment (including of default interest, which shall continue to accrue) under the applicable Debt Documents even if its obligation to make such payment is restricted at any time. The accrual 229 ----- and Capitalisation of interest (if any) in accordance with the applicable Debt Documents shall continue notwithstanding the issue of a payment stop notice. _Cure of Payment Stop_ If: (i) at any time following the issue of a Second Lien Payment Stop Notice or the occurrence of a Senior Secured Payment Default that Second Lien Payment Stop Notice ceases to be outstanding and/or (as the case may be) the Senior Secured Payment Default ceases to be continuing; and (ii) the relevant Debtor then promptly pays to the Second Lien Creditors an amount equal to any payments which had accrued under the Second Lien Finance Documents and which would have been Permitted Second Lien Payments but for that Second Lien Payment Stop Notice or Senior Secured Payment Default (as the case may be), then any event of default which may have occurred under a Second Lien Finance Document and any Second Lien Enforcement Notice which may have been issued as a result of that suspension of payments shall be deemed automatically waived without any further action being required by the Second Lien Creditors. _Permitted Payments in Respect of Topco Liabilities_ Prior to the first date on which all of the Senior Liabilities, the Super Senior Liabilities, the Senior Secured Notes Liabilities and the Second Lien Liabilities (together, the “Secured Liabilities”) have been discharged (the “Priority Discharge Date”), the Debtors, the members of the Group, the Topco Borrowers and the Third-Party Security Providers may only make specified payments in respect of the Topco Liabilities, in accordance with the finance documents governing such Topco Liabilities, subject to compliance with certain conditions in the Intercreditor Agreement. The principal conditions are that the relevant payment (if it is a payment of principal or capitalised interest) is not prohibited by any prior ranking financing agreement, including any Permitted Super Senior Secured Facilities Agreement, Permitted Senior Secured Facilities Agreement, any Senior Secured Notes Indenture, any Second Lien Facility Agreement and any Second Lien Notes Indenture (or if it is so prohibited, that all necessary consents have been obtained to permit it), no payment stop notice has been issued to the agent or trustee for the relevant Topco Liabilities and Senior Secured Payment Default or payment default (subject to a de minimis threshold in the case of amounts other than principal, interest or certain fees) is continuing under the Second Lien Facility Agreement. Certain specified payments in respect of Topco Liabilities are also permitted at all times, notwithstanding that a payment stop notice is outstanding or such a payment default is continuing. These payments and basket amounts are substantially similar to those referenced for Second Lien Liabilities in (ii) of “Permitted Payments in Respect of _Second Lien Liabilities” above._

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING ARRANGEMENTS
Subsubsection Text: Subject to certain exceptions, the Intercreditor Agreement provides that if, at any time prior to the latest to occur of the Super Senior Discharge Date, the Senior Secured Discharge Date, the first date on which all of the Second Lien Liabilities have been fully discharged (the “Second Lien Discharge Date”) and the first date on which all of the Topco Liabilities have been fully discharged (the “Topco Discharge Date”) (the “Final Discharge Date”) any creditor (other than a Senior Secured Creditor on or after the Designation Date) receives or recovers from any Debtor, member of the Group or Third-Party Security Provider: (i) any payment or distribution of, or on account of or in relation to, any of the liabilities owed to the creditors under the Debt Documents other than any payment or distribution which is either (x) not prohibited under the Intercreditor Agreement or (y) made in accordance with the provisions set out below under “Application of Proceeds”; (ii) any amount by way of set-off which does not give effect to a payment permitted under the Intercreditor Agreement; 230 ----- (iii) any amount: (1) on account of, or in relation to, any of the liabilities owed to the creditors under the Debt Documents (I) after the occurrence of an acceleration event or the enforcement of any Transaction Security as a result of such an acceleration event, or (II) as a result of any other litigation or proceedings against a Debtor, member of the Group or any Third-Party Security Provider (other than after the occurrence of an Insolvency Event (as defined below)); or (2) by way of set-off in respect of any of the Liabilities owed to it after the occurrence of an acceleration event or the enforcement of any Transaction Security as a result of such an acceleration event; (iv) the proceeds of any enforcement of any of the Transaction Security except in accordance with the provisions set out below under “Application of Proceeds”; or (v) any distribution in cash or in kind or payment of, or on account of or in relation to, any of the liabilities owed by any Debtor, any member of the Group or Third-Party Security Provider which is not in accordance with the provisions set out below under “Application of Proceeds” and which is made as a result of, or after, the occurrence of an Insolvency Event in respect of that Debtor, member of the Group or Third-Party Security Provider, that creditor will: (i) in relation to receipts and recoveries not received or recovered by way of set-off (x) hold an amount of that receipt or recovery equal to the relevant liabilities (or if less, the amount received or recovered) on trust for (or otherwise on behalf and for the account of) the Security Agent and promptly pay or distribute that amount to the Security Agent for application in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement, and (y) promptly pay or distribute an amount equal to the amount (if any) by which the receipt or recovery exceeds the relevant liabilities to the Security Agent for application in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement; and (ii) in relation to receipts and recoveries received or recovered by way of set-off, promptly pay an amount equal to that recovery to the Security Agent for application in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement. A turnover mechanism on substantially the same terms applies in the event that, at any time on or after the Designation Date but prior to the Final Discharge Date, any Senior Secured Creditor receives or recovers from any Debtor, any member of the Group or Third-Party Security Provider (x) any proceeds from the enforcement of security or from a Distressed Disposal (as defined below) or following an acceleration event or the enforcement of security, any proceeds arising from any of the charged property or (y) any other amounts which should otherwise be received or recovered by the Security Agent except in accordance with the provisions set out below under “Application of _Proceeds.”_

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING ARRANGEMENTS
Subsubsection Text: “Insolvency Event” is defined as, in relation to a Debtor, Material Subsidiary (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) or Third-Party Security Provider, (a) any resolution is passed or order made for insolvency, bankruptcy, winding up, dissolution, administration, examination or reorganisation (excluding solvent reorganisations), (b) a composition, compromise, assignment or arrangement with any class of creditors generally (other than any Secured Party) in connection with or as a result of any financial difficulty on the part of that Obligor, Material Subsidiary or Third-Party Security Provider, (c) a moratorium is declared in relation to any of its indebtedness, (d) the appointment of a liquidator, receiver, examiner, administrative receiver, administrator, compulsory manager or other similar officer in respect of it or any of its assets, or (e) any analogous procedure or step is taken in any jurisdiction, other than (in each case), frivolous or vexatious proceedings, proceedings or appointments which the Security Agent is satisfied will be withdrawn or unsuccessful or as permitted under the Senior Facilities 231 ----- Agreement or in any Permitted Senior Secured Facilities Agreement, Permitted Super Senior Secured Facilities Agreement or a Second Lien Facility Agreement, or otherwise not constituting a default. The Intercreditor Agreement provides that, after the occurrence of an Insolvency Event, any party entitled to receive a distribution out of the assets of a Debtor, Material Subsidiary or Third-Party Security Provider (in the case of a Senior Secured Creditor on or after the Designation Date, only to the extent such amounts constitute proceeds of enforcement) shall direct the person responsible for the distribution to pay that distribution to the Security Agent until the liabilities owing to the Secured Parties have been paid in full. The Security Agent shall apply all such distributions paid to it in accordance with the provisions set out under “Application of _Proceeds” below. To the extent any member of the Group’s or Third-Party Security Provider’s liabilities to creditors are, with certain exceptions, discharged by way of set-off (mandatory or otherwise and in the case of a Senior Secured Creditor on or after the Designation Date, only to the extent such amounts constitute proceeds of enforcement) after the occurrence of an Insolvency Event, any creditor benefiting from such set-off shall pay an amount equal to the amount of the liabilities owed to it which are discharged by that set-off to the Security Agent for application in accordance with the provisions set out under “Application of Proceeds” below. If the Security Agent or any other Secured Party receives a distribution in a form other than in cash in respect of any liabilities, the liabilities will not be reduced by that distribution until and except to the extent the realisation proceeds are actually applied towards such liabilities. Subject to certain netting and set-off rights under ancillary or cash management facilities, each creditor irrevocably authorises the Security Agent to take Enforcement Action (as defined below), make demands, collect and receive distributions, file claims and take other actions necessary to make recovery after the occurrence of an Insolvency Event in relation to an Obligor, member of the Group or Third-Party Security Provider. The creditors agree to do all things the Security Agent reasonably requests in order to give effect to these provisions.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING ARRANGEMENTS
Subsubsection Text: _Instructing Group_ An “Instructing Group” means: (1) if the Designation Date has not occurred: (a) prior to the Senior Secured Discharge Date, the Majority Senior Secured Creditors; (b) on or after the Senior Secured Discharge Date but before the Priority Discharge Date, the Majority Second Lien Creditors; and (c) on or after the Priority Discharge Date but before the Topco Discharge Date, the Majority Topco Creditors (as defined below); and (2) at any time on or after the occurrence of the Designation Date and: (a) prior to the later of the Senior Secured Discharge Date and the first date on which the Super Senior Liabilities have been fully and finally discharged (the “Super Senior Discharge

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING ARRANGEMENTS
Subsubsection Text: The Intercreditor Agreement also provides that the liabilities owed by any member of the Group (other than any Topco Proceeds Loan Liabilities, Topco Liabilities and liabilities to an Affiliate of a Subordinated Creditor that is not itself a Subordinated Creditor) to the Senior Notes Issuer (in its capacity as original Subordinated Creditor), owed by any member of the Topco Group (as defined below) to any direct or indirect shareholder of the Senior Notes Issuer, or owed by any member of the Topco Group to any other person who becomes a subordinated creditor (a “Subordinated Creditor”) under the Intercreditor Agreement (the “Subordinated Liabilities”) will be subordinated to the liabilities owed by the Debtors and (only to the extent it has expressly assumed any such liabilities or obligations) Third-Party Security Providers to the Secured Parties and to the Intra-Group Liabilities. _Transaction Security_ The Intercreditor Agreement provides that the Transaction Security (irrespective of whether the related Transaction Security Documents are themselves expressed to be first ranking or of any lower ranking security) shall, subject to the terms of this Agreement, rank and secure the applicable Secured Obligations (but only to the extent that such Transaction Security is expressed to secure those Liabilities) in the following order: (i) first, the Senior Secured Creditor Liabilities (as defined below) _pari passu and without any preference between them; (ii) second, the Second Lien Liabilities pari passu and without any preference between them; and (iii) third (to the extent of the Topco Shared Security), the Topco Liabilities pari passu and without any preference between them, in each case, as applicable, subject to the order of application and equalisation provisions of the Intercreditor Agreement (each summarised below). For the purposes of this description only: “Debt Documents” means the Intercreditor Agreement and the documents creating or evidencing the Cash Management Facility Liabilities, the Hedging Liabilities, the Second Lien Liabilities, the Senior Secured Liabilities, any Senior Secured Notes Proceeds Loan Liabilities, the Topco Liabilities, the Topco Proceeds Loan Liabilities, the unsecured liabilities of any unsecured creditors who are party to the Intercreditor Agreement, the Subordinated Liabilities and the Intra-Group Liabilities (each as defined in this description) and any other document designated as such by the Security Agent and the Senior Secured Notes Issuer. “Designation Date” means the first date that the Senior Secured Notes Issuer designates any liabilities under the Debt Documents as Super Senior Liabilities in accordance with the Intercreditor Agreement. “Finance Documents” means the Senior Facilities Agreement, any Permitted Senior Secured Facilities Agreement, any Permitted Super Senior Secured Facilities Agreement, the Existing Senior Secured Notes Indentures, the Senior Secured Notes Indenture and any other indenture in respect of any other Senior Secured Notes (each a “Senior Secured Notes Indenture”), any Second Lien Facility Agreement, the indenture in respect of any Second 224 ----- Lien Notes, the facility agreement documenting any Topco Facility, the Existing Senior Notes Indenture and any other indenture in respect of any other Topco Notes and any document designated by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer as an unsecured finance document under and in accordance with the Intercreditor Agreement. “Priority Secured Parties” means the Secured Parties other than the Topco Creditors. “Secured Creditors” means the Senior Secured Creditors, Second Lien Creditors and (only in respect of Topco Shared Security and Topco Independent Transaction Security) the Topco Creditors (each as defined below). “Secured Debt Documents” means the documents relating to the Senior Secured Liabilities, Second Lien Liabilities, Topco Liabilities and Hedging Liabilities and any other document designated as such by the Security Agent and the Senior Secured Notes Issuer under and in accordance with the Intercreditor Agreement. “Senior Secured Liabilities” means the Senior Lender Liabilities, the Cash Management Facility Liabilities, the Hedging Liabilities, the Super Senior Liabilities and the Senior Secured Notes Liabilities. “Third-Party Security Provider” means Topco and any person that has provided Transaction Security (including Topco Shared Security) but is not a Debtor in respect of any direct borrowing or guarantee liabilities of the applicable secured obligations to which that Transaction Security relates and which is designated as such by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer (in its discretion). “Topco Facility” means any credit facility made available to a Topco Borrower. “Topco Independent Obligor” means Bellis Midco 4 Limited as the Original Topco Independent Obligor and each Topco Borrower or any of its Affiliates (in each case, other than a member of the Group) or any member of the Group that directly holds shares in a Topco Borrower or any such person that is not a member of the Group which is designated as such by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer (in its discretion) by written notice to each Agent who is a party to the Intercreditor Agreement at such time, and, in each case, which entity has not ceased to be a Topco Independent Obligor in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement. “Topco Independent Transaction Security” refers to any Security granted by a Topco Independent Obligor (excluding, for the avoidance of doubt, any asset which at the time any security is granted in respect thereof comprises Transaction Security) and provided that any Topco Independent Transaction Security granted by any member of the Group that is a direct shareholder of a Topco Borrower shall be limited to only such shares and any intercompany loans or other receivables owed to such member of the Group by the relevant Topco Borrower and provided further that any recourse to such member of the Group under such Topco Independent Transaction Security shall be limited only to the assets the subject of the Topco Independent Transaction Security; and provided further that such shares or receivables are not subject to (or are not required at such time of any designation by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer of Topco Independent Transaction Security in relation thereto to be subject to) the Transaction Security pursuant to the provisions of any Finance Document which, to the extent legally possible and subject to any Topco Agreed Security Principles and the provisions of the Intercreditor Agreement: (i) is created, or expressed to be created, in favour of the Security Agent as agent or trustee for the other Topco Secured Parties (as defined below) (or a class of Topco Secured Parties) in respect of the Topco Independent Secured Obligations; or (ii) in the case of any jurisdiction in which effective Security cannot be granted in favour of the Security Agent as agent or trustee for the Topco Secured Parties (or a class of Topco Secured Parties) is created, or expressed to be created in favour of: (x) all the Topco Secured Parties (or a class of Topco Secured Parties) in respect of the Topco Independent Secured Obligations; or (y) the Security Agent under a parallel debt and/or joint and several creditorship structure for the benefit of all the Topco Secured Parties (or a class of Topco Secured Parties) in respect of the Topco Independent Secured Obligations, and which is in each case (unless otherwise designated by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer (in its discretion) by written notice to each Agent who is a party to the Intercreditor Agreement at such time) not in favour of the other Secured Parties and subject to certain provisions of the Intercreditor Agreement. “Topco Shared Security” refers to security at any time which is created, or expressed to be created, over any of the following: (i) the shares in the Senior Secured Notes Issuer held by any direct shareholder of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, (ii) all receivables owed by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer to a Topco Investor, Subordinated Creditor or other holding company or shareholder of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer (including any Topco Proceeds Loan and the Topco Proceeds Loan Liabilities), (iii) the shares in any Topco Borrower which is a member of the 225 ----- Group, (iv) all receivables owed by a member of the Group under any Topco Proceeds Loan (or, in the case of a Topco Borrower which is a member of the Group, any Senior Secured Notes Proceeds Loan), (v) any escrow account relating to the proceeds of any Topco Liabilities and (vi) any other assets not falling within limbs (i), (ii), (iii), (iv) and (v) of this paragraph of a Topco Borrower (if not a member of the Group) and (to the extent the Senior Secured Notes Issuer has confirmed to the Security Agent that the granting of such Security in favour of the Topco Shared Security Secured Obligations is not prohibited by the terms of any applicable Prior Ranking Financing Agreements) of any member of the Group, in each case to the extent provided for by the Topco Finance Documents (as defined below) at any time and in each case designated as Topco Shared Security by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer (in its discretion) in favour of the Security Agent as agent or trustee for the other
